title: Didn't receive my dependent(wife receipt number from uscis for H4 visa extension
question: Hi,
answers:
I would speak to a lawyer directly about this - the lawyer who applied should be trying to get you an answer, or speak to a different one.

I don't know why it would be so difficult to get the case number off the back of the canceled check. However, your wife should be able to call USCIS directly and try to get status (the difficulty will be in navigating the phone tree to get through to a real person - using the case number form your H-1B and indicating that the case is overdue - essentially true since the H-4 is arguably directly connected to this case - should work.

While USCIS would not speak with you on the H-1B since you are neither the Petitioner (your company) or the attorney, the H-4 is technically an "Application" rather than a Petition and your wife the "Applicant" - so they should be willing to speak with her. She can ask for the case number and status.

If this doesn't work, only a lawyer's involvement is likely to help.

If your company paid by check and the check was cashed, look at the back of the check there should be a WAC number or some number. It is usually your receipt number. This is why you should always have different checks. Talk to an immigration lawyer if you have more questions. Our law firm is located in Newark Ca (Bay Area) and has handle hundreds of H1B and H4 cases.

Good Luck
